            About Me
            Samuel Blay Nguah is a paediatrician and medical
            statistician based in Kumasi, the second-largest city in
            Ghana. He is a Senior Lecturer in the Department of Child
            Health of the School of Medicine and Dentistry, Kwame
            Nkrumah University of Science and Technology.
            He has been practising as a Medical Doctor at the Komfo
            Anokye Teaching Hospital since the year 2000 and as a
            paediatrician since the year 2005. He has a special interest
            in Paediatric Cardiology and has been caring for children
            with both congenital and acquired heart diseases since
            2007.
            He takes delight in teaching, hence his appointment at
            the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology as a
            lecturer in 2016.
            As a medical statistician, he has actively taken part in
            many surveys and research, with well over 50 publications in
            peer-reviewed medical journals. He is an ardent user of the
            R software for data analysis and visualization. He
            frequently gives talks to resident doctors in training on
            topics, including research methods and biostatistics.
            His hobbies include reading, swimming and gardening.
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Samuel Blay Nguah MD

              About Me
              Samuel Blay Nguah is a paediatrician and medical
              statistician based in Kumasi, the second-largest city in

              He has been practising as a Medical Doctor at the Komfo
              Anokye Teaching Hospital since the year 2000 and as a
              paediatrician since the year 2005. He has a special
              interest in Paediatric Cardiology and has been caring for
              children with both congenital and acquired heart diseases
              since 2007.
              He takes delight in teaching, hence his appointment at
              the Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology as
              a lecturer in 2016.
              As a medical statistician, he has actively taken part
              in many surveys and research, with well over 50
              publications in peer-reviewed medical journals. He is an
              ardent user of the R software for data analysis and
              visualization. He frequently gives talks to resident
              doctors in training on topics, including research methods

              His hobbies include reading, swimming and

articles.title: My Talks
articles.description: This page is a compilation of some of the talks I have given recently. To view the slide deck, please click the headings above the description of the talk.
articles.contents:
Overview of Clinical Research

Date: April 28, 2023
This talk was given to the Faculty of Family Medicine of the Ghana College and the West African College of Physicians and Surgeons. It spanned the steps involved in initiating clinical research, data collection and tools, data management, data cleaning, data analysis, and presentation of data.

Presentation of Data and Statistical Tests

Date: August 1, 2023
As part of the Ghana Medical Journal workshop, this talk was done. It went through how to present and review the statistical analysis and results sections of a journal article.

Epidemiology & Biostatistics

Date: August 7, 2023
This talk was given to the residents of the Faculty of Paediatrics and Child Health of the Ghana College of Physicians and Surgeons. Content includes some basic epidemiological terminologies, evaluating diagnostic tests, effects, basic statistics, descriptive statistics and inferential statistics.
